summary:
Guinea-Bissau is a West African country, formerly known as Portuguese Guinea. It gained independence in 1973-1974 and added "Bissau" to its name to avoid confusion with Guinea. The country has a rich history, once part of the Kaabu kingdom and the Mali Empire. It was colonized by Portugal in the 19th century, and Portuguese is the official language, though only 2% speak it natively. The national language is Guinea-Bissau Creole, a Portuguese-based creole spoken by over half the population.

Guinea-Bissau has faced political instability since independence. It has a diverse population with followers of Islam, Christianity, and traditional African religions. The country is a member of various international organizations.
title: Guinea-Bissau
